body_html:
many thanks,

I tried that but unfortunately it says that it is expecting numbers below 2^31 (or something along those lines). I even tried lambda x: np.random.seed(torch.initial_seed() + x) which would be more correct as it would seed each thread with a different seed. Same problem, of course.

Still, with both methods, even if they worked, as well as with lambda x: np.random.seed(x) the workers (in my case) produce exactly the same numbers again and again at every epoch.

for me the only viable solution was lambda _: np.random.seed() which makes me lose control of the seed of those random sequences but at least ensures that same sequences "never" gets repeated.

body:
many thanks, 

I tried that but unfortunately it says that it is expecting numbers below 2^31 (or something along those lines). I even tried `lambda x: np.random.seed(torch.initial_seed() + x)` which would be more correct as it would seed each thread with a different seed. Same problem, of course.

Still, with both methods, even if they worked, as well as with `lambda x: np.random.seed(x)` the workers (in my case) produce exactly the same numbers again and again at every epoch. 

for me the only viable solution was `lambda _: np.random.seed()` which makes me lose control of the seed of those random sequences but at least ensures that same sequences "never" gets repeated.
